page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This block contains a landscape of contrasts,between the coniferous forests of the Haldon Hills ridge and the pasture and arable landscape developed on the red permian rocks on the west side of the river Exe. The Haldon Hill ridge consists of upper Grensand rocks,on which are developed relatively poor soils.Formerly part of the Mamhead estate, much of this land now supports commercial forestry under the management of the forestry commission. On the fertile red rocks of the lower land,cereal crops are grown, and large areas are pasture for sheep,and beef and dairy cattle.The area includes several valleys,and on the sheltered slopes facing the sun are several large greenhouses producing horticultural crops for London,and local markets.
